posts.cooked:
We are lot of people with same problem, It happened when we ran out of space on our phone, and since then it’s been impossible to use signal without losing all our data! A joke for an application that was supposed to protect our data lol

I opened Signal and received the same message, “Problem Retrieving Data.” I immediately continued with recovery but it got stuck at 56% for about 10 seconds, then continued to 72%, then the “Data Not Recovered” message came up. I figured all was lost so I went ahead and pressed “Rest Signal,” and the app just crashed, so I went to Settings > General > iPhone Storage > Signal and it looked like all my data was still there

Same problem on all version of signal since few months, no update fix it, why? Our data is not important ? The only way is to delete signal and lose all our data!!!

please fix it!

We make free space on our phones but still the same problem, 20GB free space and only 5GB signal data but not possible to restore it

github.com/signalapp/Signal-iOS

Crash on Launch (Launch Failure)

opened 08:44AM - 05 Jul 22 UTC
closed 01:15PM - 07 Sep 24 UTC
radix007
stale

<!-- This is a bug report template. By following the instructions below and fill…ing out the sections with your information, you will help the developers get all the necessary data to fix your issue. You can also preview your report before submitting it. You may remove sections that aren't relevant to your particular case. Before we begin, please note that this tracker is only for issues. It is not for questions, comments, or feature requests. If you would like to discuss a new feature or submit suggestions, please visit the community forum: https://community.signalusers.org If you are looking for support, please visit our support center: https://support.signal.org/ or email support@signal.org Let's begin with a checklist: Replace the empty checkboxes [ ] below with checked ones [x] accordingly. --> - [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] I am submitting a bug report for existing functionality that does not work as intended - [x] This isn't a feature request or a discussion topic ---------------------------------------- ### Bug description Whenever I am opening Signal iOS app it is showing me **Couldn't Open Signal. Signal had a problem while trying to open. Please send a debug log to support@signal.org to help troubleshoot this issue.** ### Steps to reproduce - Open Signal App - Small Prompt in the bottom shows the message "**Couldn't Open Signal**" - Two options shown at this point: **Submit Debug Log** or **Open Signal Instead** - When I click on **Open Signal** instead app crashes and I return back to home screen - When I click on **submit debug log**, it creates the log and gives various options to share the log like: **Email Support, Copy Link, Open a Bug Report, Share and Cancel** - After clicking on either of these options in no case does the app open. It is only crashing and then we repeat the whole process again - **_I also tried to uninstall the app and install again. It was working then but after 5-6 hours the bug started to show up again._** **Actual result:** The app does not open and crashes every time **Expected result:** The app should open when I click on use signal app instead or after I close it. Not really sure why this is happening. ### Screenshot ![Signal App Launch Crash](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47687097/177286874-be3f41f5-29e8-4f9f-827f-897195f27f58.jpg) ### Device info **Device**: iPhone 6 **iOS version**: 12.5.5 (16H62) **Signal version:** 5.42.0.12 ### Link to debug log https://debuglogs.org/ios/5.42.0/1827923fba28c363a2d491730d8b11ef55524d521220bf4d98cfefdf3b85f94f.zip <!-- If this is a crashing bug, after filing this issue, email a copy of your latest crash report to support@whispersystems.org To get a crash log: 1. Go to the iOS Settings app. 2. Go to Privacy. 3. Go to Analytics or Diagnostics & Usage. 4. Select Analytics Data or Diagnostics & Usage Data. 5. Locate the .ips crash log for Signal. The logs will be named in the format: Signal(DateTime).ips 6. Select the desired Signal log. 7.a iOS 11 users, tap the Share icon in the top right corner and jump to step 10. 7.b iOS 9&10 users, long press to see the option to highlight text and select the entire text of the log. It will end in EOF. 8. Once the text is selected, tap Copy. 9. Paste the copied text into an email. 10. Send the email to support@signal.org with a subject like: * "iOS Crash Log: (your github issue)" * Example subject: iOS Crash Log: Crash on launch #111 * Example subject: iOS Crash Log: Crash when sending video #222 -->

If you would like to discuss a new feature or submit suggestions, please visit the community forum: https://community.signalusers.org If you are looking for support, please visit our support center: https://support.signal.org/ or email support@signal.org Let's begin with a checklist: Replace the empty checkboxes [ ] below with checked ones [x] accordingly. --> - [X] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates (this is similar but just in a comment; https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-iOS/issues/5395#issuecomment-1561927054) - [X] I am submitting a bug report for existing functionality that does not work as intended - [X] This isn't a feature request or a discussion topic ---------------------------------------- ### Bug description When I start Signal, I get the "Problem Retrieving Data" screen. After confirming it, the all displays that it is now recovering the database but crashes after 10 seconds. There is no way to skip the recovery or retrieve debug logs. It might be the case that this was triggered by a full device storage, but now there is >1GB space free. ### Steps to reproduce - Start app - Immediately get "Problem Retrieving Data" screen - Click continue - For 10 seconds, get recovery screen **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) - App crashes without Error message or debug log - No access to existing or new messages, not able to send messages **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) - Successful Recovery - Able to start Signal and access messages ### Screenshots ![IMG_20240520_105620_451](https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-iOS/assets/527767/c37a2404-a90f-4a0b-8d46-dd7486291fe7) ![IMG_20240520_105616_814](https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-iOS/assets/527767/c8b86ce4-b6d4-4d11-99a4-42ac5382ea31) ### Device info **Device**: iPhone SE 2020 **iOS version**: 17.3.1 **Signal version:** 7.11 ### Link to debug log - Log from app not available - Log from iOS send to signal support. <!-- If this is a crashing bug, after filing this issue, email a copy of your latest crash report to support@whispersystems.org To get a crash log: 1. Go to the iOS Settings app. 2. Go to Privacy. 3. Go to Analytics or Diagnostics & Usage. 4. Select Analytics Data or Diagnostics & Usage Data. 5. Locate the .ips crash log for Signal. The logs will be named in the format: Signal(DateTime).ips 6. Select the desired Signal log. 7.a iOS 11 users, tap the Share icon in the top right corner and jump to step 10. 7.b iOS 9&10 users, long press to see the option to highlight text and select the entire text of the log. It will end in EOF. 8. Once the text is selected, tap Copy. 9. Paste the copied text into an email. 10. Send the email to support@signal.org with a subject like: * "iOS Crash Log: (your github issue)" * Example subject: iOS Crash Log: Crash on launch #111 * Example subject: iOS Crash Log: Crash when sending video #222 -->

Signal crash, after no more free space "Problem Retrieving Data"

opened 02:51PM - 31 May 24 UTC
Nerodelo

Hi I got same issue as lot of people after no more free space on my iPhone, I ma…ke more space but Signal app still crash My iPhone was running out of space and I opened signal. Now after freeing up space the Signal app says "Problem Retrieving Data" and immediately crashes when I click continue. Is there no way to recover the data? I can't sent report with the tap 8 times, because app crash before the report option, please fix it I don't want to lose my personal data Bug description When I start Signal, I get the "Problem Retrieving Data" screen. After confirming it, the all displays that it is now recovering the database but crashes after 10 seconds. There is no way to skip the recovery or retrieve debug logs. It might be the case that this was triggered by a full device storage, but now there is >1GB space free. Steps to reproduce Start app Immediately get "Problem Retrieving Data" screen Click continue For 10 seconds, get recovery screen Actual result: Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) App crashes without Error message or debug log No access to existing or new messages, not able to send messages Expected result: Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) Successful Recovery Able to start Signal and access messages Device info Device: iPhone 12 Pro iOS version: 17.3.1 Signal version: 7.11 Link to debug log Log from app not available Log from iOS can't be send to signal because app crash before

Lot of people in comments, on forums, reddit, apple review, please fix it we want our data

posts.cooked: Yes @patjolata we have many threads and issues on github about this problem but still no update to fix it since years, privacy is good but what about our data? We don’t want to lose all our data every time Signal bugs, the data is still present on my phone and I can still receive messages and read them via notifications but I can no longer access the app and see my old messages because of this problem

@nishatsu making every time a new thread and spamming at at other topics isn’t going to resolve it any faster.

As you can see here the support here is unofficial and mostly done by users who use Signal and want to help out.

I’ve no clue how they handle issues on GitHub but if you want official support from Signal themself: https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us

Edit: Like @patjolata said it seems to be the best to continue here instead: "Problem Retrieving Data" and then Signal app crash

posts.cooked:
@Megan I didn’t create a new thread about this problem, I replied to the thread that is from 2024, soon more than a year and still no update, our data is on our phone we can receive notifications of new messages but impossible to access signal even with more than 10gb of free space

We have already contacted signal by e-mail for a year, they answer but once we send the log report no more answer about this problem, our data belong to us but are inaccessible.

nishatsu:

We have already contacted signal by e-mail for a year, they answer but once we send the log report no more answer about this problem, our data belong to us but are inaccessible.

Do you bring the question up again by sending a reminder in the emails? Because when I get in contact with someone for support and I don’t receive a response after X time since the last message I send them a reminder.

Bringing it up again and again and again will only slow everything down.

Yes, they asked me to do the update but it didn’t solve the problem, then I sent another log report but no more replies, several of us have been in this situation for nearly a year and more for some of us
Send another reply to the last email that you received from them as reminder.
I already do it last month but no update
